subsection.name: Install Maven
subsection.p: Hippo ECM is built using Maven 2 (version 2.0.6 or newer). Follow the Maven installation instructions.

div.p:
For Windows users
You need to take care that your local Maven 2 repository is not located in a folder with spaces in the pathname. The default Maven installation procedure will locate it in your home directory which on Windows is a subdirectory of the "Documents and Settings" directory. This means that you need to relocate your local Maven repository.
Create and edit the file c:\Documents and Settings\<Your Name>\.m2\settings.xml with the following content:
This effectively relocates your local Maven repository to c:\mvnhome.

subsection.name: Get the Hippo ECM source
subsection.p: The source can be found at https://svn.hippocms.org/repos/hippo/hippo-ecm and can be anonymously checked out using any Subversion client. Instructions on Subversion use can be found at http://svnbook.red-bean.com/. The following command checks out the trunk to a directory called 'hippo-ecm'

subsection.name: Run
subsection.p: The preferred way of running Hippo ECM is by deploying the application wars in an application server.
To facilitate development it is also possible to run Hippo ECM from the commandline using Jetty. To start a sample application from the command line, execute the following commands:
subsection.source: ~/> cd hippo-ecm ~/hippo-ecm> mvn install ~/hippo-ecm> cd package/war ~/hippo-ecm/package/war> mvn clean jetty:run-war
subsection.p: The mvn install is required to put all project artifacts (jars, wars) in your local maven repository, as required by the maven-jetty-plugin.
Open a web browser and go to http://localhost:8080 to navigate and edit your repository.
